intro: Odontocarya perforata, commonly known as the perforate odontocarya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its basal leaves that are arranged in a rosette and have a distinctive perforated appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Odontocarya perforata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments.
